org.linqs.psl.reasoner.term.streaming

Class StreamingTermStore<T extends ReasonerTerm>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.linqs.psl.reasoner.term.streaming.StreamingTermStore<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, TermStore<T,GroundAtom>, VariableTermStore<T,GroundAtom>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DCDStreamingTermStore, OnlineTermStore, SGDStreamingTermStore

    public abstract class StreamingTermStore<T extends ReasonerTerm>
extends Object
implements VariableTermStore<T,GroundAtom>
    A term store that does not hold all the terms in memory, but instead keeps most terms on disk. Variables are kept in memory, but terms are kept on disk.

        protected boolean randomizePageAccess

        protected boolean warnRules

      • termBuffer

        protected ByteBuffer termBuffer
        The IO buffer for terms. This buffer is only written on the first iteration, and contains only components of the terms that do not change.

      • volatileBuffer

        protected ByteBuffer volatileBuffer
        The IO buffer for volatile values. These values change every iteration, and need to be updated.

      • termCache

        protected List<T extends ReasonerTerm> termCache
        Terms in the current page. On the initial round, this is filled from DB and flushed to disk. On subsequent rounds, this is filled from disk.

      • termPool

        protected List<T extends ReasonerTerm> termPool
        Terms that we will reuse when we start pulling from the cache. This should be a fill page's worth. After the initial round, terms will bounce between here and the term cache.

      • shuffleMap

        protected int[] shuffleMap
        When we shuffle pages, we need to know how they were shuffled so the volatile cache can be writtten in the same order. So we will shuffle this list of sequential ints in the same order as the page.

    • Method Detail

      • isInitialRound

        public boolean isInitialRound()
        Whether this is the first round of iteration. During the initial round, not all terms will be loaded into the cache (they will need to be grounded). If false, users can specifically call noWriteIterator() for faster iteration.

      • ensureVariableCapacity

        public void ensureVariableCapacity(int capacity)
        Description copied from interface: TermStore
        Ensure that the underlying structures can have the required variable capacity. This is more of a hint to the store about how much memory will be used. This is best called on an empty store so it can prepare. Not all term stores will even manage variables.
        Specified by:
        ensureVariableCapacity in interface TermStore<T extends ReasonerTerm,GroundAtom>

      • noWriteIterator

        public Iterator<T> noWriteIterator()
        Get an iterator that goes over all the terms for only reading. Before this method can be called, a full iteration must have already been done. (The cache will need to have been built.)
        Specified by:
        noWriteIterator in interface TermStore<T extends ReasonerTerm,GroundAtom>

      • streamingIterator

        protected StreamingIterator<T> streamingIterator()
        Provide the iterator that will be used in iterator(), along with any additional setup. This method is used instead of just iterator() for type safety in child classes.

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: TermStore

      • variablesExternallyUpdated

        public void variablesExternallyUpdated()
        Description copied from interface: TermStore
        Notify the term store that the variables have been updated through a process external to standard optimization.

      • supportsRule

        protected boolean supportsRule(Rule rule,
                               boolean warnRules)
        Check if this term store supports this rule. If the rule is not supported and |warnRules| is true, then a warning should be logged.
        Returns:
        true if the rule is supported.

      • rejectCacheTerm

        public boolean rejectCacheTerm(T term)
        Return true if the given term read from the cache is invalid. Under normal streaming circumstances this cannot happen, but children may encounter different situations (like online inference where atoms can be deleted).

      • getGroundingIterator

        protected abstract StreamingIterator<T> getGroundingIterator()
        Get an iterator that will perform grounding queries and write pages to disk. By default, this is only called for the initial round of iteration, but children may override call this in different situations (like online inference).

      • getCacheIterator

        protected abstract StreamingIterator<T> getCacheIterator()
        Get an iterator that will read and write from disk.

      • getNoWriteIterator

        protected abstract StreamingIterator<T> getNoWriteIterator()
        Get an iterator that will not write to disk.
